title: Induced emf - spinning loop in constant field

content.description: A loop spins in a uniform magnetic field with angular speed <math alttext="omega" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>ω</mi></math>. At time <math alttext="t equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>, the plane of the loop is perpendicular to the magnetic field, as shown. Which of the following pairs of graphs correctly show the magnetic flux <math alttext="phi" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi></mstyle></math> through the loop and the induced <math alttext="e m f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>emf</mi></math> <math alttext="open E" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>Ɛ</mi></math> in the loop as functions of time?
content.question: Magnetic Flux Through the LoopInduced <math alttext="e m f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>emf</mi></math> in the LoopABCD

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
